APAP Overdose

  • Dx1
    • SSx
    • Workup
  • Tx1,2
  • References

Dx1

APAP toxicity usually seen with ingestions of >10g or 200mg/kg in 24hr OR >6g or 150mg/kg QD x2d

SSx

  • N/V
  • Anorexia
  • Abd pain
  • HypoK
  • Abnormal LFTs
  • Encephalopathy
  • Jaundice
  • Anuria

Workup

  • Serum APAP >4hr post-ingestion for nomogram below
  • Others as indicated
  • Serum ASA
  • Chem7
  • CBC
  • LFTs
  • SCr / BUN
  • Urine Tox

Tx1,2

  1. Use Rumack-Matthew Nomogram
    • if level not available w/i 8hr, treat empirically
  2. Activated Charcoal 1g/kg if recent exposure, preferably w/i 1hr, but maybe 3-4hr post-exposure
  3. NAC as dosed below if above nomogram line or if >24hr post-exposure w/ level >10 mcg/mL (mg/L)
    • Dosing wt NTE 100kg
    • 100mg/kg IV over 15-60min
    • then 50mg/kg IV over 4hr
    • then 100mg/kg IV over 16hr
    • all in D5W
    • PO therapy also available
    • watch for tinnitus and anaphylaxis
  4. Admit
    • consider transplant if AMS, PTT >100, pH < 7.3, or SCr > 3.3 after delayed therapy (>24hr post-exposure)

APAP Nomogram1

References

  1. Tintinalli JE, Stapczynski JS, Ma OJ, Cline D, Meckler GD, Yealy DM, eds. Tintinalli’s Emergency Medicine: A Comprehensive Study Guide. Eight edition. New York: McGraw-Hill Education; 2016. ↩ ↩2 ↩3

  2. Lexi-Drugs. Lexicomp. Wolters Kluwer Health, Inc. Riverwoods, IL. Available at: http://online.lexi.com. ↩
